issues.description: Return type for getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() is inconsistent across artifacts. The problem statement UML declares getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor(): int (lines 70-72 in problem_statement.md), while the template's comment explicitly says the return type should be double for precise calculation (template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java, lines 16-18) and the provided solution implements getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() with return type double (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java, lines 84-87). This mismatch can confuse students about which return type to implement and may lead to failing tests or incorrect implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type consistent across all artifacts. Preferred resolution: update the problem statement UML and any textual hints to specify getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor(): double (and mention that a double is used for precise calculation). Alternatively, if an integer result is intended pedagogically, change the template comment and the solution implementation to return int, and update any explanatory text accordingly.
